content.description: Traverse your way to the start and you will find a super good, huge jug where you can have both feet on prior to the vertical start. Â From there, it goes straight up and a bit to the left, finish with an odd top out.3 stars because it's DWS it the middle of Oregon!
content.protection: The water is the protection but having a friend watching is nice (current may be strong).
content.location: If you GPS "Lobster Creek Campground," it will put you right by the bridge. Go to Lobster Creek Bridge and the rock is located on the north end of the bridge and there is a little trail that goes down the side of the bridge to the rock.

content.description: DEEP WATER SOLO. The water is safe below but always double check!! This bouldering area is located just below the Lobster Creek Bridge and is a known cliff jumping spot. Being said, I started cleaning the rock for at least one solid problem (deep water solo).The rock is really solid and you have to traverse your way to get to the start of the vertical climb. I'd recommend cleaning the top-out area of loose rocks/gravel prior to climbing. It's a really fun climb and you can keep your shoes dry from the start (assuming you don't fall or bail!).
